metadata.synopsis: After the players free Nightsong she is returned to her former glory
metadata.how_to_trigger: Free Nightsong during the SHA_NightsongPrison_NightsongsFate dialog or the SHA_NightsongPrison_OM_Shadowheart_* dialogs

47.speaker: Nightsong
47.text:
Our Lady of Silver. Hear me!
She Who Guides, the Moonmaiden Selûne -
MOTHER OF THE SO-CALLED NIGHTSONG.
THE NIGHTSONG IS NO MORE!
47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She kneels, head down, allowing the player to lay a hand upon her shoulder. As the hand makes contact, the hands appear upon her again - they glow and burs/ fade awayt. She steps forward nervously and stumbles, not having been free in a century and momentarily dizzied by the prospect of it. She catches herself on hand and knees, her head hanging. She begins to beat the ground with a fist in a slow, powerful rhythm. Then, she begins to hum an ancient, almost Gregorian chant. As she hums, the sound of it echoing through the Shadowfell builds and morphs into a chorus humming in harmony with her. She raises herself to her feet, but the rhythm continues, as does the song, independently of her.

As the music swells, Nightsong raises her voice in an invocation
NodeContext: Shouted to the heavens.

48.speaker: Nightsong
48.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A moonbeam lands on Nightsong, like a spotlight. She begins to glow as the music swells and reaches its climax.
Within the moonbeam, she transforms. Her wounds heal, and her rusted, dirty armour and torn clothes begin to mend.
The ragged, violently marred costume she was wearing is replaced, piece by piece, with the shining armour of a paladin of Selune.The spotlight on Nightsong fades. She is renewed, beautiful, powerful.

NodeContext: With joy and gratitiude. Not ego, but fact.

54.speaker: Nightsong
54.text: You have given me a great gift, little warrior. Don't you find it oh-so-curious that you would spurn your Dark Lady? Perhaps you feel a stirring of the truth already.

50.speaker: Nightsong
50.text: But that will come later. There is a battle yet to be fought.

0.speaker: Nightsong
0.text: You have done what we feared was impossible. You have released me from a century of sorrow.

14.speaker: Nightsong
14.text: Your power is great. So too must be your weapon. You must choose what you will wield. And the Moonmaiden will provide. Thus I have said; thus will it be so.

57.speaker: Nightsong
57.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: Dark Lady be merciful... What have I done?

55.speaker: Nightsong
55.text: You have done me an incredible service. The Moonmaiden has blessed you in kind.

58.speaker: Nightsong
58.text: And now? Now, Ketheric Thorm must die.
58.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: To get out of this place? Absolutely.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: To get out of this place? Absolutely.

43.speaker: Nightsong
43.text: Ho! We'll do more than that, my friend.

10.speaker: Nightsong
10.text: Ho! And it shall be yours. And then?

6.speaker: Nightsong
6.text: We're going to kill Ketheric Thorm.
6.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

53.speaker: Nightsong
53.text:
Our Lady of Silver. Hear me!
She Who Guides, the Moonmaiden Selûne -
MOTHER OF THE SO-CALLED NIGHTSONG.
THE NIGHTSONG IS NO MORE!

She steps forward nervously and stumbles, not having been free in a century and momentarily dizzied by the prospect of it. She catches herself on hand and knees, her head hanging. As she hums, the sound of it echoing through the Shadowfell builds and morphs into a chorus humming in harmony with her. NodeContext: Shouted to the heavens.

49.speaker: Nightsong
49.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A moonbeam lands on Nightsong, like a spotlight. She begins to glow as the music swells and reaches its climax.
Within the moonbeam, she transforms. Her wounds heal, and her rusted, dirty armour and torn clothes begin to mend.
The ragged, violently marred costume she was wearing is replaced, piece by piece, with the shining armour of a paladin of Selune.The spotlight on Nightsong fades. She is renewed, beautiful, powerful.

NodeContext: With joy and gratitiude. Not ego, but fact.

35.speaker: Nightsong
35.text: You have injured me, soldier. But you have given me a great gift, too.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: What have you done? She was to be Shar's sacrifice - her death was to be my destiny!

26.speaker: Nightsong
26.text: It is your turn, my friend.

2.speaker: Nightsong
2.text: You have done what we feared was impossible. You have released me from a century of sorrow.

5.speaker: Nightsong
5.text: Your power is great. So too must be your weapon. You must choose what you will wield. And the Moonmaiden will provide. Thus I have said; thus will it be so.

3.speaker: Nightsong
3.context: NodeContext: Her last line before flying off. Determination and vigour.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: We need to leave. Lady Shar won't stand for us to be here - not after what we did.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks apprehensiveNodeContext: Worried

9.speaker: Player
9.text: If Shar is angry, she's being remarkably quiet about it.

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: That's what frightens me. She must be angry, yet I don't feel it, or hear it... There's only silence.
32.context: NodeContext: Frightened, as if expecting Shar to confront her any moment.

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: Let's get out of here, please. Whatever's coming, I don't want to be in the heart of the Shadowfell when it finds me.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: The Nightsong will be headed for Moonrise Towers. We'd better get there, and see what she's unleashed against Ketheric Thorm.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: All right, let's get out of here.

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: I'm not sure there's a place that's far enough away for me to go. Lady Shar must be angry... but there's only silence.
33.context: NodeContext: Frightened as if expecting Shar to confront her any moment.

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *A shudder of fear runs through you. Lady Shar asked you to prove yourself - and you failed.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *Yet no pain, no recrimination. Only silence. And somehow, this strikes you as worse.*
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks at her hand with some surprise and fear.

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *It is time to leave this place, and see what chaos you have unleashed upon Moonrise Towers.*

46.context: CinematicNodeContext: She flies superman style out of the Shadowfell and carves a path to Moonrise towers, lighting up the shadowcursed lands with a path of pure light.InternalNodeContext: DIALOGUE END OPENS TREASURE WINDOW WITH SELUNITE WEAPONS FOR THE PLAYER TO CHOOSE FROM.
